info.title: International Trade Administration API
info.description: This is an inventory of APIs available at the International Trade Administration.

get.description: The Market Research Library API provides metadata for country and industry reports that are produced by ITA's trade experts and are available in ITA's online market research library. ITA commercial officers that are stationed around the world, publish these authoritative reports in conjunction with Foreign Service officers from the State Department.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns market research reports for a match in the description or title fields.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns market research reports for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns market research reports for specific controlled industry terms. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on their expiration date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The Consolidated Screening List API consolidates eleven export screening lists of the Departments of Commerce, State and the Treasury into a single data feed as an aid to industry in conducting electronic screens of potential parties to regulated transactions.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the name, alt_names, remarks, and title fields from all eleven lists.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the lists specified by the Source Abbreviation.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Searches only entities whose country, nationalities, or citizenships fields match the country code based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. The country fields are found in the addresses and ids arrays. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per entity.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Searches against fields in the addresses array.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Searches against the name and alt_names fields.

parameters.name: fuzzy_name
parameters.description: Set fuzzy_name=true to utilize fuzzy name matching.  Fuzzy name matching enables users to query a name and get usable results without knowing the exact spelling of an entry.  The fuzzy_name parameter only works in tandem with name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Searches based on the type of the entry (e.g, Individual, Entity, Vessel).

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on their start date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on their end date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: issue_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the issue dates of the ids array. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the expiration dates of the ids array. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The Trade Events API provides data on events for U.S. businesses interested in selling their products and services overseas. These events include industry conferences, webinars, lectures, and trade missions organized by ITA and other trade agencies.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the registration_title, description, event_name, industries, city, venues.city, venues.state, venues.country, contacts.first_name, contacts.last_name, and contacts.person_title fields.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns trade events for specific controlled industry terms. This method allows you to search for multiple industries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns trade events for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per event.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade events for a specific Trade Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: world_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade events for a specific World Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the events specified by the Source Abbreviation.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Returns events based on their start date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns events based on their end date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The Trade Leads API provides contract opportunities for U.S. businesses selling their products and services overseas. These leads come from a variety of sources.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the title, description, topic, tags, industry, ita_industries, and procurement_organization fields.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for specific controlled industry terms. This method allows you to search for multiple industries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per lead.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for a specific Trade Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: world_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for a specific World Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the leads specified by the Source field.

parameters.name: publish_date
parameters.description: Returns leads based on their publish date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns leads based on their end date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: publish_date_amended
parameters.description: Returns leads based on their amended publish date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The Tariff Rates API provides data about each country with whom the United States has a Free Trade Agreement (FTA). When the U.S. enters into an FTA with a foreign government, it negotiates lower tariff rates with that government for a wide variety of products. A tariff is a tax that a company must pay a foreign country when shipping a product to that country. Typically the FTA tariffs rates decline over several years.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the subheading_description, tariff_rate_quota_note, rule_text, and tariff_line fields.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Returns tariff rates based on the ISO alpha-2 country codes of the source country. This method allows you to search for multiple sources (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: final_years
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the final_year field. Years are specified as a comma-delimited list.

parameters.name: partner_start_years
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the partner_start_year field. Years are specified as a comma-delimited list.

parameters.name: reporter_start_years
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the reporter_start_year field. Years are specified as a comma-delimited list.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) API includes more than 200 commonly asked questions about exporting. The answers provided are from government experts that specialize in unique aspects of trade.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the question and answer fields.

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Returns FAQs based on topic name. This method allows you to search for multiple topics (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns FAQs for specific controlled industry terms. This method allows you to search for multiple industries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns FAQs based on trade region.  This method allows you to search for multiple trade regions separated by commas.

parameters.name: world_regions
parameters.description: Returns FAQs based on world region.  This method allows you to search for multiple world regions separated by commas.

parameters.name: first_published_date
parameters.description: Returns FAQs based on the date they were first published.  Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format:  YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd.  Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: last_published_date
parameters.description: Returns FAQs based on the date they were last updated.  Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format:  YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd.  Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The ITA Offices & Centers API provides contact and address information for all of ITA's domestic and international export assistance centers. There are almost 200 ITA centers worldwide whose locations are managed by ITA's internal office management system.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns office locations for a match within the post or office name fields.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on city name.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Returns locations for export assistance centers located in a specific U.S. State or Dependent Area.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per office location.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The Trade News & Articles API provides in-depth news and articles written by Trade Specialists working in the Federal government. The authors include staff from ITA as well as other Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee (TPCC) agencies.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the title, short_title, summary, content, and keyword fields.

parameters.name: export_phases
parameters.description: Returns articles based on the export phase. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns articles for specific controlled industry terms. This method allows you to search for multiple industries separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.  This method allows you to search for multiple countries separated by commas.

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Returns articles based on topic. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: sub_topics
parameters.description: Returns articles based on sub-topic. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: geo_regions
parameters.description: Returns articles based on geo region. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: geo_subregions
parameters.description: Returns articles based on geo sub-region. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns articles based on trade region. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: trade_programs
parameters.description: Returns articles based on trade program. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: trade_initiatives
parameters.description: Returns articles based on trade initiative. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: creation_date
parameters.description: Returns articles based on the date they were created. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format: YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: release_date
parameters.description: Returns articles based on their release date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format: YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Returns articles based on their expiration date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format: YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

get.description: The Zip Code to USEAC API provides direct access to the U.S. Export Assistance Centers (USEACs) that have been assigned to all of the 40,000+ zip codes in the United States.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns zip code entries for a match within the post, office_name or zip_city fields.

parameters.name: zip_codes
parameters.description: Returns zip code entries that match the specified zip codes. Enter muliple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

200.description: History information for the given user

get.description: The Business Service Providers (BSP) API is a directory of U.S. and foreign-based businesses providing services that many small and medium sized exporters require to succeed in foreign markets Parameters.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns business service providers for a match in the company_name, company_description, or contact_name fields.

parameters.name: ita_offices
parameters.description: Returns business service providers based on country. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Returns business service providers for a specific category. Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

200.description: History information for the given user

get.description: The ITA Taxonomies API gives developers direct access to the exporting, trade, and investment terms that ITA uses to tag the content and data in its other APIs.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns taxonomy terms for a match within label field.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Returns terms that fall under the given high-level taxonomy types. Enter multiple values separated by commas. The possible values are Industries, Topics, Countries, Trade Regions, and World Regions.

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Returns terms based on exact matching of the label field. Enter multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

get.description: The De Minimis API provides data about the De Minimis amount and the Value Added Tax (VAT) amount that products may be subject to when exported to foreign countries.  De Minimis is the threshold for a products value below which no duty or tax is charged.  Furthermore, products below the De Minimis undergo minimal clearance procedures, such as customs and paperwork requirements.  Similarly, the value of the exported products must exceed the VAT amount before it is subject to VAT.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns de minimis rates for a match in the country or notes fields.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns de minimis rates based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.  Enter multiple terms by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the atom, references, section, summary, and title fields.  Note:  the atom field is searchable, but not returned in the JSON results.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns articles for a specific controlled industry term. This method allows you to search for multiple industries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Returns articles for a specific topic term. This method allows you to search for multiple topics (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns articles for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per event.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns articles for a specific Trade Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: world_regions
parameters.description: Returns articles for a specific World Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the articles specified by the Source Abbreviation.

parameters.name: first_published_date
parameters.description: Returns articles based on their initial publish date.  Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format:  YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd.  Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: last_published_date
parameters.description: Returns articles based on their most recent publish date.  Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format:  YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd.  Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

id.description: Unique identifier assigned to the report.

countries.description: Country category(ies) assigned to the report.

expiration_date.description: Date when the report is no longer valid.

industries.description: Industry categories assigned to the report.

ita_industries.description: The ITA industries associated with the report.

report_type.description: The report type can either be CCG, Best Market Report, or Market Research Report.

alt_names.description: Alias names used by the entity.

source_information_url.description: Information from the Source agency about the list.

ids.description: An array showing specific identification information of the entity.

entity_number.description: Unique id assigned by the originating list.

start_date.description: The effective date for the entity to be included on the list as defined by the Federal Register Notice.

end_date.description: The date on which the entity's inclusion on the list will be lifted, waived, or will have expired.

federal_register_notice.description: The official source of information about the parties on this list.

license_requirement.description: The license requirement as determined by the Export Administration Regulations.

license_policy.description: The policy set forth in the Export Administration Regulations regarding denial.

remarks.description: Additional remarks or notes regarding the company, entity, or person on the list.

standard_order.description: Whether or not (Y/N) the standard order applies to the Denied Party as defined by the Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS).

programs.description: Agency programs related to the entity on the list.

source.description: The name of the source list where this entity is listed.

gross_registered_tonnage.description: The gross weight in tons registered for the vessel.

gross_tonnage.description: The gross weight in tons not-registered for the vessel.

vessel_type.description: Describes the type of vessel (ferry, bulk cargo, tug).

start_time.description: The start time of the event.

end_date.description: The date the event will end.

end_time.description: The end time of the event.

time_zone.description: The time zone of the events location.

cost_currency.description: The currency of the cost value.

registration_link.description: URL for the event's registration page.

industries.description: Industry categories assigned to the event.

ita_industries.description: The ITA industries associated with the assigned industries.

url.description: Link to the event's web page.

trade_regions.description: The trade regions associated with the event.

world_regions.description: The world regions associated with the event.

country.description: Country where the procurement opportunity is taking place.

publish_date_amended.description: Amended publish date for the lead.

status.description: Status of the lead (note this API only shows open leads).

industry.description: Industry category assigned to the opportunity.

ita_industries.description: ITA industry terms associated with the assigned industry.

project_size.description: Budget for project in U.S. dollars.

min_contract_value.description: Minimum value of the lead (in U.K. pounds).

max_contract_value.description: Maximum value of the lead (in U.K. pounds).

trade_agreement.description: Relevant trade agreement for the contract.

non_competitive_procurement_strategy.description: States whether it is a competitive procurement.

urls.description: URLs that pertain to the bid.

source.description: Entity providing the trade lead information.

lead_source.description: Source of the trade lead, typically an organization.

categories.description: Array of categories that describe the procurement opportunity.

parent_id.description: Procurement opportunity that this lead is related to.

procurement_method.description: Describes who may respond to the lead.

topic.description: Short description of the category that the lead falls under
Short description of the category that the lead falls under

url.description: URL that pertains to the bid.

trade_regions.description: The trade regions associated with the lead.

world_regions.description: The world regions associated with the lead.

source.description: Two letter code for the reporter country with whom the U.S. has the Free Trade Agreement.

tariff_line.description: Product's Harmonized System (HS) code for the product according to the reporter's nomenclature.

subheading_description.description: English description at the subheading level (6-digit HS code).

base_rate.description: The numeric tariff rate from which tariff reductions are calculated. Typically, this is the applied tariff rate at the time the FTA was negotiated.

base_rate_alt.description: The non-numeric (specific) tariff rate from which the tariff reductions are calculated. Typically, this is the applied tariff rate at the time the FTA was negotiated.

final_year.description: The year the tariff is eliminated under the FTA.

tariff_rate_quota.description: Flag noting tariff treatment for products within quota (2) and out of quota (1).

tariff_rate_quota_note.description: Text note about the tariff-rate quota (TRQ) applicable to the product.

tariff_eliminated.description: Flag noting whether or not the tariff is eventually eliminated. False= not eliminated.

staging_basket.description: The agreed tariff phase-out period for the product under the FTA.

partner_start_year.description: Year the agreement entered into force for the partner. (The first year of tariff cuts).

reporter_start_year.description: Year the agreement entered into force for the reporter. (The first year of tariff cuts).

partner_agreement_name.description: Agreement name for the partner country.

reporter_agreement_name.description: Agreement name for the reporter country.

quota_name.description: Description for products subject to tariff-rate quotas. (Describes in-quota and out-of-quota tariff lines).

rule_text.description: Text describing the applicable rule of origin for the product.

link_text.description: Text describing URL to more detailed rule of origin information.

link_url.description: URL to more detailed rule of origin information.

annual_rates.description: Numeric year-by-year tariff rates under the FTA as the tariff is eliminated.

annual_rates_alt.description: Non-numeric (specific) year-by-year tariff rates under the FTA.

question.description: The question being addressed by the FAQ.

answer.description: The answer portion of the FAQ.

first_published_date.description: The date the FAQ was first published.

last_published_date.description: The date the FAQ was last updated.

url.description: The URL where the published FAQ can be viewed.

industries.description: Industry categories assigned to the FAQ.

topics.description: Topic categories assigned to the FAQ.

trade_regions.description: Trade regions relevent to the FAQ.

world_regions.description: World regions relevent to the FAQ.

short_title.description: A shortened title for the article.

summary.description: A summary of the article's content.

creation_date.description: The date of the article's creation.

release_date.description: The date of the article's release.

expiration_date.description: The date of the article's expiration.

source_business_units.description: The business units for each source agency.

source_offices.description: The offices for each source business unit.

evergreen.description: Flag to designate timeless articles, always topically relevant.

keyword.description: A list of keywords for the article assigned by the author.

export_phases.description: The export phases assigned to the article.

industries.description: The industries assigned to the article.

countries.description: The countries associated with the article.

topics.description: The topics assigned to the article.

sub_topics.description: The sub-topics assigned to the article for each topic.

geo_regions.description: The world regions covered by the article's content.

geo_subregions.description: The world sub-regions associated with the article for each geo region.

trade_regions.description: The trade regions covered by the article's content.

trade_programs.description: The trade programs covered by the article's content.

trade_initiatives.description: The trade initiatives covered by the article's content.

file_url.description: The URLs for files included in the article.

image_url.description: The URLs for images included in the article.

url_html_source.description: The URL for the HTML of the article's source.

url_xml_source.description: The URL for the XML of the article's source.

zip_city.description: Name of the city corresponding to the ZIP code.

country.description: This will always be US since this is a list of ITA offices in the U.S.

post_city.description: Name of the city corresponding to the office location.

company_name.description: Name of company providing the service.

company_address.description: Street, city, and country address for company.

ita_office.description: Name of ITA office that has provided company information.

category.description: Category of services that company provides.

id.description: The id assigned to the term.

label.description: The name of the given taxonomy term.

type.description: The high level taxonomy type under which the given term belongs.

sub_class_of.description: An array containing hashes with the id and label of each parent term.

datatype_properties.description: A hash containing key/array pairs of datatype properties. Each array contains id/label hashes.

annotations.description: A hash containing key/array pairs of object properties. Each array contains id/label hashes.

de_minimis_value.description: De Minimis value for that country

de_minimis_currency.description: ISO-3 currency code for the country's De Minimis

vat_currency.description: ISO-3 currency code for the country's VAT

notes.description: Notes for each De Minimis and VAT amount

source.description: The source type of the article.

summary.description: A short summary of the article's content.

first_published_date.description: The date that the article of first published.

last_published_date.description: The article's most recent publish date.

url_name.description: A unique URL indentifier for the article.

industries.description: The ITA industry terms associated with the article.

topics.description: The ITA topic terms associated with the article.

countries.description: The countries relevant to the article.

trade_regions.description: The trade regions relevant to the article.

world_regions.description: The world regions relevant to the article.
